# `list-runs` {#list-runs-subcommand.unnambered}

The `list-runs` subcommand lists the runs defined in a given pyANI-plus SQLite3 database.

```shell
 $ pyani-plus list-runs -h
                                                                                     
 Usage: pyani-plus list-runs [OPTIONS]                                               
                                                                                     
 List the runs defined in a given pyANI-plus SQLite3 database.                       
                                                                                     
╭─ Options ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
│ *  --database          FILE  Path to pyANI-plus SQLite3 database [required]       │
│    --help      -h            Show this message and exit.                          │
╰───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
```
